a kind of snake.
a disorder in which there is a loss of pigment resulting in white patches on the skin; vitiligo.
a variety in sandal tree; white sandal.
a white umbrella used as a royal insignia or as a mark of reverence.
(fig.) a place of protection or the act of protecting.
any of several large-bodied, web-footed waterfowl with a long, graceful neck and, typically, pure white feathers; a swan.
a white horse.
Arjuna, whose horses were white in colour.
Vaikuṇṭha, abode of Viṣṇu.
the fortnight from the day follwing the new moonday to the full moonday; the first fortnight of any Hindu lunar month.
a white cloth.
(jain.) one of the schools of Jaina Svētāmbara cult.

(fig.) any in-depth, authoritative, transparent report.
a kind of tree.
the tree Moringa oleifera ( = M. pterygosperma, = Hyperanthera moranga) of Moringaceae family.
its slender, long fruit, used as a vegetable; drum-stick.
the blood that is pale or whitish.
the pale red colour.
the moon.
(myth.) name of a particular period of thousand yugas (eras); (4,320 million years).
a kind of flute.
a bauddha or jaina monk wearing white clothes.
a man riding on a white horse or having (for his chariot) white horse or horses.
the moon.
Arjuna, who has white horses for his chariot.
the plant Ericaulon quinquangulare of Eriocaulaceae family.
a man suffering from vitiligo, characterised by white patches of skin.
a white cloth.

unbroken grains of soaked rice, used in death ceremonies.
a white kind of Agallochum.
